intro: Encelia maculata, commonly known as the California poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant orange or red-orange petals and yellow centers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and coastal dunes. Its leaves are gray-green and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often branched and upright. Encelia maculata is known for its adaptability to arid conditions and its role in supporting local pollinators.
